storyInfo: At the dinner party, the nobles chatter cheerfully. Heidi, unable to join in the conversation, takes every opportunity to talk with Kal'tsit, and creates a chance to be alone with her—in fact, this young child has a special assignment.

attributes.content: Ah, Cleric Kal'tsit, you're finally here. Er, your mode of dress...
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: I was deeply honored by your invitation, but with sudden matters to attend to, the monastery could not prepare suitable evening attire for me. They found only this outfit buried in the storeroom. I hope you shan't mind.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Oh, quite naturally, I shan't. I'd go so far as to say your attire is utterly... utterly, formidably gallant.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Heidi, you don't just stand there. Here, this is Cleric Kal'tsit. Give her a greeting, and then hurry inside quickly.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Heidi?
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Miss Heidi, it's good to meet you.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Ah—er—uh, th—um, I'm Heidi—
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: I know it already. An adorable name.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: —So you're—Cleric Kal'tsit, is that right? I often hear my uncle mention you.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: The pleasure is mine.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Cleric Kal'tsit, I imagine you know of Mr. Thomson too? Quite, this is Heidi Thomson before you, that strange fellow's daughter.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: I see. Your father is a person worthy of respect.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Right, then, do come in, Cleric.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Thank you again for your generosity, Sir Vincent.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Oh, did you know the Count went to Londinium? Have you ever been in that city before?
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: Don't remind me! I once had everything packed up ready, and then! A Catastrophe Messenger came trotting along to say: the road ahead's blocked, you all go back.
attributes.name: Tipsy Businessman

attributes.content: I was beside myself returning home. Immediately had a great bout of illness.
attributes.name: Tipsy Businessman

attributes.content: Oh, my, how dearly wretched.
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: Is that auspicious poet coming today? I've a few works I wrote in private, and I'd hoped he could do the honor of appraising them.
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: Perish the thought! Have you forgotten just how many manuscripts from 'thinkers' Thomson's torn up in front of the Count?
attributes.name: Tipsy Businessman

attributes.content: Oh, I remember. Thomson's ruthless. He even said himself, 'The clash of ideas ought to be a ruthless thing.' Truly frightening, he is.
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: It's not a be-all nor end-all to show off.
attributes.name: Tipsy Businessman

attributes.content: My, my, but the charm's all in young men like that, isn't it? Mettle to test, romantic and free.
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: Of course I admit, I once admired Thomson for those qualities. But in front of the Count, Thomson still can't shake off his own deliberate arrogance.
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: Deliberate? Thomson?
attributes.name: Tipsy Businessman

attributes.content: Isn't it obvious? He regards our esteemed Count, after all. Forget just nobility and status; in these last years, the Count's governed his land with perfect order. It's plain for all of us to see.
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: Hoh! Toron's not his land in name, mind, it's for all of us to manage, but I'll admit the Count deserves his reputation for leading! I do have to respect the man!
attributes.name: Tipsy Businessman

attributes.content: And lest we forget, he's had multiple invitations to the gatherings at Londinium. Don't you think our little place—allow me to admit our border situation—deserves some sense of pride?
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: Hah, nobles.
attributes.name: Tipsy Businessman

attributes.content: My, let's not make the topic so stiff. We're all people of Victoria, aren't we?
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: Ha! People! Ever since that outrageous hanging, we can barely claim to know whose people we are!
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: Simmer down. We all regret Our Majesty's departure, but we can still drink a few toasts here today, you see?
attributes.name: Tipsy Businessman

attributes.content: In other words, today's a happy day. Don't bring up anything so frightful—look, here comes the Count.
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: I overheard your conversation. Very intriguing, Richard. I'd much like to take a look at your writings.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Oh, poppycock. Good Count, in comparison to you, my little effort pales like a man under a skyscraper.
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: That's right, Vincent, hurry and tell us of your trip to Londinium, let us all hear it. Who did you meet? Any Grand Dukes of living legend?
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: In due time, everyone, in due time. The night has just begun. Don't forget, today is a day of festival celebration.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Allow me to introduce to you all two special guests of ours.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Cleric Kal'tsit, do come.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Good evening, honorable guests. Allow me to give my most sincere respects to you all.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: What, now! By your appearance... my, you're a lady? Oh, what a mighty shame...
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: I think it's not much of a shame at all. Cleric Kal'tsit, good evening.
attributes.name: Tipsy Businessman

attributes.content: Oh—oh—Cleric Kal'tsit, I believe I remember the Count speaking of you. I hear you treated his wife, and so garnered his good favor?
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: With regards to the Count's wife, that was no light affair.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Do tell us about where you're from. Laterano clerics who aren't Sankta are so rare. My, let alone ones so... charming as you.
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: Beautiful miss, where do you come from? And where will you go?
attributes.name: Tipsy Businessman

attributes.content: Aren't I the one asking? Don't you interrupt.
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: The Count gives word that you're a pillar of talent. Do you have any inclination for philosophy or the arts? Any unique insights, perhaps?
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: You flatter me. It was only chance I aided the Count's wife. I have the distinction of his recognition, that's all.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Oh—if you're familiar with the Count, surely you know Sir Thomson too, then?
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: Of course. Sir Thomson is a rarity of a scholar in Toron. I often hear the Count talk of him.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Then things couldn't align better. Servant! Please fetch the wine I brought. I wish to have a proper causerie with the Count and the Cleric!
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: Don't you dominate our soirée, you egomaniac. Can't we all just chat about something fun? For example, that fashion walk at Londinium...
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: Fine by me. Everyone, just let me rest my legs for a while here. I'll be soaking in the knowledge.
attributes.name: Tipsy Businessman

attributes.content: Now, aren't you a lazy one. Your estate would be doubled by now if not for that!
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: Three wineries still isn't enough?
attributes.name: Tipsy Businessman

attributes.content: Oh, right, you mentioned you had another guest. I don't know if—
attributes.name: Tipsy Businessman

attributes.content: Good evening, Misters and Misses.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Heidi! What are you doing here!
attributes.name: Tipsy Businessman

attributes.content: Little Heidi, you're very prettily dressed today... that bastard Thomson. I fear for all my life, it's children alone where I'll never compare to him.
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: Now, now. Heidi isn't even of drinking age. None of you hand her a wine glass. Servants, if you could pour her a cream soda.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Don't always treat me like a child, Uncle Vincent.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: But drinking laws are drinking laws. Your father specifically warned me. After all, you're at that age...
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: (Pout...)
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Alright, alright. Strike the cream soda and replace it with ginger ale.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: I don't need you to coddle me like this!
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Ha ha, little Heidi's eager to grow up.
attributes.name: Tipsy Businessman

attributes.content: It's sad. No father wants to see his daughter grow up this quickly. I was like that at her age too. Only wanted to buy some jewelry, and my father gave me a tongue-lashing for it.
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: Even if you won't let me drink, at least, can I join the dinner party? Let's see... I'll sit right here!
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: It would be my honor, Miss Heidi. Allow me to hold your hat for you.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Ah... no—no need, I'll be fine with it on...
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Good, then. Heidi, don't forget that you came here tonight in secret. In a while, you be good and sleep for the night upstairs.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Mnngh...
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: You dress very much like your mother, girl.
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: But right now—
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: Mnnngh...!!
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Cleric Kal'tsit, do you think I'm still a child too?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: To you, I see no reason why it should matter.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Let me pour your glass for you. Here's your ginger ale.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Th... thank you...
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Is it to your liking?
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: It's actually quite a nice drink.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Oh, my, there is no alcohol in ginger ale, is there? What's gotten your face red?
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: The girl's wary of strangers. It's nothing new.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Come, friends! Seeing as we're all present, let us officially begin!
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: You're most correct! The height of Leithanien's arts capture all hearts alike, but those Leithanians are far too pompous about themselves! What affords them to look down on us!
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: Leithanien, oh, Leithanien. They've had too much misfortune... I haven't stopped hearing Witch King stories since I was a baby. Who knows if the Twin Empresses will have managed to sort out that king by the time I visit the place!
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: Who would visit knowing the terror of the Witch King...
attributes.name: Tipsy Businessman

attributes.content: Unlike the monarchs who ascended young, the Witch King became emperor at nearly fifty years of age, and then governed Leithanien for many more.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Undoubtedly, the Witch King is the greatest Caster in all our lands. He turned himself into a freak of nature!
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: He's just like those horrible stories depicted him. His horns all bent into strange shapes, emitting this strange energy...
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: Oh! I've never seen the Witch King shown in a newspaper before—*belch*—Sorry there, this wine's just too fine. But I have seen photos of the Twin Empresses, come to think of it. One gleaming gold, one dark as night.
attributes.name: Tipsy Businessman

attributes.content: Leithanien is in flux. Presumably, the Witch King rarely leaves his tower. From start to finish, he's gazed dispassionately at Leithanien, and even when he grants an audience, it's as he casts a grand shadow from atop his tower.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Yet the last time he touched the ground, he was morphed beyond recognition. His wretchedness, his two horns cut off by the Twin Empresses apiece, drew true sighs of lament.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: The full picture of that coup d'etat is still unclear to us, but to my knowledge, even our most heroically adored Wanderer would never match the Witch King's true strength.
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: This being why when the Empresses' Voice arrived at Victoria escorted by the knights, the Grand Dukes were all still willing to suspend their quarrels, and treat each other with respect.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Pardon? It sounds as though—you've been to Londinium before?
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: I arrived from there. It was a local Sankta's enlightening me that led me on this path.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Ha-ha, Kal'tsit, didn't I say? These are all wonderful friends of mine. See just how popular you are.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Truth is, I have a girl about the same age as you. She only knows how to splash my hard-earned money away all the damned day... How nice it'd be if she could learn from you.
attributes.name: Tipsy Businessman

attributes.content: Getting to know you tonight has been a truly wonderful time. Can I ask if you're still single, dear Kal'tsit?
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: Cleric Kal'tsit!
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Oh, Heidi, don't cut in so randomly. You should be heading upstairs to turn in about now.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Allow her to speak, Count. In this day and age, children are always much more mature than we imagine.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Hm.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Cleric Kal'tsit... have—can I ask if you've been to Ursus before?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Oh, that nation rife with rebellion and violence.
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: When I was studying abroad, I spent some time at Deity Grypherburg. Are you interested in Ursus?
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Yes!
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Papa once gave me a few books to read, by an Ursus author...
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Ursus only ever produces two kinds of arts: raucous sensationalism, or true eternal greats.
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: If Thomson liked it, chances are it was the latter, wasn't it?
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: Hmph. You lot really do trust him.
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: Papa really put him in high esteem. He even wanted to go to Deity Grypherburg himself to visit him, but business always meant he had to put it off, and this year with his old injuries flaring up again, he wasn't able to go.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Your father was injured?
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: That's right. He broke his knee, and then put off surgery for too long, so it's not fully treated.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: I warned him. Ah, no idea what happened last year. He came scrabbling back with wounds all over, and all he'd say was he ran into a robber and dropped off a cliff. Wasn't interested in saying much else.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Do you want to go to Ursus? Miss Heidi?
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Now that won't do! The death of the last Emperor and the rebellions had a profound effect on the country. Should you want to study there, you'd do well to wait a few years first.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: I'm just talking about it... What impression do you have of the country?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: I'll tell you a story.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: It's the story of how Ursus's Sixth Army were annihilated, without a trace, by a bottle of vodka.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Well, this rumor doesn't sound plausible at all.
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: When any event is boiled down to its cause, its conclusion tends to sound unexpected. We're all used to the process, aren't we?
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: That does make sense.
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: It began with a ruffian from the Army 'collecting rent' in one of their garrison regions, and without realizing, he menaced a noble.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: That act fermented the whole way through. The Sixth Army then were always considered utterly corrupt, the old nobles' power rooted too deep, while the Fifth Army were unconditionally obedient to the young Emperor and the brand new State Council.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: We have no way to know for sure who fired the first shot, but as for the outcome, the Fifth Army ultimately seized the chance to revolt, and in between two cities' paths, started a direct firefight with the Sixth Army.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: The prologue to 'The Great Rebellion' comes in many editions. I've definitely heard a few things of the Sixth Army's varied deeds.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: They fought just like that?
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: If it were that simple, then it wouldn't have been dubbed 'The Great Rebellion.'
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Being a border guard outfit, the Fourth Army, with a domain of authority and influence decidedly not in the hinterlands, suddenly switched sides to support the State Council, and proactively declared no relationship to the 'traitors' in the Sixth Army.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: After the execution of a few prepared scapegoats, the old nobility had only the Sixth and Eighth Armies left in hand.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Come winter the following year, the nobility backing the Eighth Army pulled that same trick, capitulating alike to the Emperor.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: And so, the bitter fate of the Sixth Army who had staked it all on one throw, we can well imagine.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: And the cause of all of this—very simple, one we all know. Simply a drunk ruffian, taking the vodka bottle he had in hand to attack a young noble.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: A marvelous story, Cleric Kal'tsit, and might I even confirm, this tale is little removed from the reality at all.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Heidi, I would not tell you that 'this is how Ursus is.' Every civilization in this world deserves you seeing it for yourself. They should be appreciated, and have to be reflected upon.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: In that Ursus you admire, what have you seen?
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Perhaps the farms and public houses, perhaps the grand heroes, perhaps the highs and lows of life in Deity Grypherburg's opera house. But what I've seen is the Great Rebellion's aftermath, an age on the verge of collapse.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Might Victoria have such an age of its own someday?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: I will not guarantee it either way, Miss Heidi.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: How could it! Here, you little child. Are you afraid now, because of Cleric Kal'tsit's smidgen story of Ursus?
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: I've no intent to insult the Ursus people, but the Empire of Ursus is unarguably a savage, unreasonable nation.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: But right now, isn't Londinium just as—
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: —Don't even say it. Though it pains us all that it happened, did Victoria waver for even a moment?
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Alright, alright, Count, seeing as the topic's come around, I think it's high time you told us about that trip to Londinium, yes? That's what we're most interested in.
attributes.name: Tipsy Businessman

attributes.content: What high nobility did you meet?
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: I'd be honored to tell. Truth is, on the way, the Duke of Normandy personally invited me to a shindig, together at his flagship...
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: What! And you managed to keep from telling us all the way to today...!
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: My, it was the Duke of Normandy himself... He always did detest Leithanians. Did he and the envoys of the Empresses' Voice have a scuffle?
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: No, but by his retainer's words, the good Duke never once made eye contact with those gorgeous envoys that evening.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Ah-ha, now that's the proper manner of a 'Duke.'
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: Ursus's theatrical Grand Dukes might number more in hundreds than tens—alright, maybe not that many, but they are quite unchecked, and if I might add, somewhat incompetent too.
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: That's a form of arrogance, but I must say, everyone who's experienced the Londinium manner for themselves would echo the sentiment.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: I trust the Duke of Normandy need only rely on his own power to make those Leithanian greed-blinded extremists know their place for a few dozen years. Let alone the fact we've certainly more than a single Duke...
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Tuckered out, Heidi?
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Hm? No... I'm still thinking about what Cleric Kal'tsit said. Could I talk with her alone for a bit?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Oh, if we're to talk Londinium without Kal'tsit, it would certainly be much duller.
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: You flatter me.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Now, no rush. I see the Baron of Rye is calling at me, so I'll need to chit-chat with him now. I assure you, I'll be back shortly to tell the full tale.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Does this all bore you? Miss Heidi?
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Huh? Ah... no, it doesn't, I'm alright.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Fine... erm, it's just, I thought we'd talk more about poetry, or the wheat harvest, but it turns out not...
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Sick of foreign politics?
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Um, ha ha...
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: It's what tonight's dinner party was meant for.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: I can see, you also consider it somewhat boring, don't you?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: You understand more than anyone, and you can't stand all those people in a giggling gaggle around Uncle Vincent, correct?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: You seem to have some misunderstanding about me...
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Ha ha, we only met tonight, didn't we? You're right, Cleric Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: You can call me just Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Then, Kal'tsit... could you walk with me?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: In a while longer, Uncle Vincent will have me sent off into the loft. I certainly don't want to go to bed this early.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: The snow seems to have gotten heavier. Would you mind that...?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: —I wouldn't. Allow me to accompany you.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: What a snowstorm!
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: The biggest one in recent years.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: I like the snow, Kal'tsit, and I like my home too.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Phew... how cold.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Everyone's all huddling inside by the fireplace.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: It's just us two now, Kal'tsit... hee-hee, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: —It's so difficult to be alone with you.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: You're yet young... Heidi.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Your father shouldn't have let you get involved so easily.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: But that's what I wanted, Kal'tsit. I wished to do something or other, instead of hiding in the warm house, gazing out, just as a child would.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: When winter truly comes, would a single oak of Victoria's be spared from the blizzard? Then that being the case, we should prepare early.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: You resemble your father greatly.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: —Is that a compliment?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Let's say it is.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Hee-hee... ah, nobody should find us here, so...
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Now I can hand these letters to you.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Your father's intelligence operatives are never late. They're the best Messengers, workers, and aspirants in all of Victoria—except this time.
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: Has something happened?
attributes.name: Kal

attributes.content: The young Heidi makes not an innocent step more.
She is right. Before upheaval arrives, the young must always be the soonest to prepare.
—There are two letters, Dame Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: One from all of Victoria, and another from 'Kazdel.'
attributes.name: Heidi
